intro: Sparattosperma leucanthum, commonly known as the white-flowered spathesperma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
